item.title: Sorry Albert!
item.description:
Sorry Albert!

Creativity is hiding your resources...I think that you might be wrong on this one.

No one can deny the importance of discussing and building on each other’s ideas when you’re sailing towards the same goal. Outcomes of a productive and efficient team is very likely to be highly rewarding for all team members especially if out of this procedure comes knowledge, new information and better skills. Resources is Knowledge. Knowledge is Progress. Progress is a team effort. To make it clear, I believe that sharing resources leads to a more effective teamwork. So Albert, im’ sorry -i think that creativity is all about sharing resources...Here you are welcome to enjoy mine!

item.title: Project Fi
item.description:
Project Fi

Project Fi is a program to deliver a fast, easy wireless experience in close partnership with leading carriers, hardware makers, and our users.

item.title: Happening now: Social Media Crisis
item.description:
Happening now: Social Media Crisis

The term "crisis" in social media refers to any rapidly and widely spread negative comment all over the web, including social networks, blogs and fora. Most frequently, we consider that we are in a crisis situation when a negative mention or complaint is rapidly reproduced in social media.

item.title: Futures of text
item.description:
Futures of text

When the weather is bad I take a bus to work. I'm forever grateful to the person at the bus stop who informed me that you can text New York's MTA service to find out exactly where the bus is and when it's going to arrive.

item.title: Adblock reveals how it charges companies to let ads through
item.description:
Adblock reveals how it charges companies to let ads through

Adblock Plus, one of the world's most popular ad blockers, is pushing to separate its acceptable ads program from its core business and make it appear more independent. Acceptable advertising is a controversial program in which sites can pay the company to allow their advertising through the filter, where it would usually be automatically blocked.

item.title: Adblocker-blockers get around sites that block adblockers
item.description:
Adblocker-blockers get around sites that block adblockers

Blocking the adblockers is becoming more common, but now there's a way to fight back.

item.title: How designers worked in 2015?
item.description:
How designers worked in 2015?

Is Sketch more popular than Photoshop? What fonts were trendy? What colors were used? See it all in the Avocode's 2015 design break down.

item.title: A deep dive into the business of virtual reality porn
item.description:
A deep dive into the business of virtual reality porn

I walk up to a large, white mansion. I knock on the door and a woman in a white shirt and black skirt opens the door. She greets me by saying "hello handsome" as if we've met before. She grabs the vacuum cleaner I'm holding in my hand and smiles before saying, "I've been meaning to replace my sucker for some time."

item.title: How Website Speed Actually Impacts Search Ranking
item.description:
How Website Speed Actually Impacts Search Ranking

Google uses a multitude of factors to determine how to rank search engine results. Typically, these factors are either related to the content of a webpage itself (the text, its URL, the titles and headers, etc.) or were measurements of the authenticity of the website itself (age of the domain name, number and quality of inbound links, etc.).
